___targetName.description: Sets the base name of the output file; type and platform specific pre- and suffixes are added automatically

___workingDirectory.description: A fixed working directory from which the generated executable will be run

___dependencies.description: List of project dependencies given as pairs of "<name>" : <version-spec>

___version.description: The version specification as used for the simple form

___path.description: Use a folder to source a package from

___subConfigurations.description: Locks the dependencies to specific configurations; a map from package name to configuration name

___targetPath.description: The destination path of the output binary

___name.description: Name of the package, used to uniquely identify the package. Must be comprised of only lower case ASCII alpha-numeric characters, "-" or "_".

___toolchainRequirements.description: Set of version requirements for DUB, for compilers and for language frontend.

___license.description: License(s) under which the project can be used

___authors.description: List of project authors. The suggested format is either "Peter Parker" or "Peter Parker <pparker@example.com>"

___subPackages.description: Defines an array of sub-packages defined in the same directory as the root project, where each entry is either a path of a sub folder or an object of the same format as a dub.json file

___name.description: Name of the package, used to uniquely identify the package. Must be comprised of only lower case ASCII alpha-numeric characters, "-" or "_".

___toolchainRequirements.description: Set of version requirements for DUB, for compilers and for language frontend.

___license.description: License(s) under which the project can be used

___authors.description: List of project authors. The suggested format is either "Peter Parker" or "Peter Parker <pparker@example.com>"

___subPackages.description: Defines an array of sub-packages defined in the same directory as the root project, where each entry is either a path of a sub folder or an object of the same format as a dub.json file

___buildTypes.description: Defines additional custom build types or overrides the default ones (chosen on the command line using --build=...)

___configurations.description: Speficies an optional list of build configurations (chosen on the command line using --config=...)

___name.description: Name of the configuration, used to uniquely identify the configuration. Must be comprised of ASCII alpha-numeric characters, "-" or "_".

___debugVersions.description: A list of D debug identifiers to be defined during compilation

___postGenerateCommands.description: A list of shell commands that is executed after project generation is finished

___sourcePaths.description: Allows to customize the path where to look for source files (any folder "source" or "src" is automatically used as a source path if no sourcePaths setting is specified) - note that you usually also need to define "importPaths" as "sourcePaths" don't influence those

___buildRequirements.description: List of required settings for the build process

___importPaths.description: Additional import paths to search for D modules (the source/ folder is used by default as a source folder, if it exists)

___copyFiles.description: A list of globs matching files or directories to be copied to targetPath. Matching directories are copied recursively, i.e. "copyFiles": ["path/to/dir"]" recursively copies dir, while "copyFiles": ["path/to/dir/*"]" only copies files within dir.

___preBuildCommands.description: A list of shell commands that is executed always before the project is built

___versions.description: A list of D versions to be defined during compilation

___postBuildCommands.description: A list of shell commands that is executed always after the project is built

___excludedSourceFiles.description: Files that should be removed for the set of already added source files (takes precedence over "sourceFiles" and "sourcePaths") - Glob matching can be used to pattern match multiple files at once

___libs.description: A list of external library names - depending on the compiler, these will be converted to the proper linker flag (e.g. "ssl" might get translated to "-L-lssl")

___sourceFiles.description: Additional files passed to the compiler - can be useful to add certain configuration dependent source files that are not contained in the general source folder

___mainSourceFile.description: Determines the file that contains the main() function. This setting can be used by dub to exclude this file in situations where a different main function is defined (e.g. for "dub test")

___preGenerateCommands.description: A list of shell commands that is executed before project generation is started

___systemDependencies.description: A textual description of the required system dependencies (external C libraries) required by the package. This will be visible on the registry and will be displayed in case of linker errors

___stringImportPaths.description: Additional import paths to search for string imports/views (the views/ folder is used by default as a string import folder, if it exists)

___lflags.description: Additional flags passed to the linker - note that these flags are usually specific to the linker in use

___dflags.description: Additional flags passed to the D compiler - note that these flags are usually specific to the compiler in use, but a set of flags is automatically translated from DMD to the selected compiler

_88buildOptions.description: List of build option identifiers (corresponding to compiler flags)
